author: Associated Press
title: Sabres forward Kane out 4-6 weeks with left knee injury
text:
Sabres forward Kane out 4-6 weeks with left knee injury Associated Press comments Tweet BUFFALO, N.Y. â€” Buffalo Sabres forward Evander Kane will be out approximately four to six weeks because of an injury to his left knee.
Coach Dan Bylsma provided the update after practice on Monday, two days after Kane was hurt in a 4-3 loss to the New Jersey Devils. Without revealing the exact nature of the injury, Bylsma said Kane won't require surgery after hurting his medial collateral ligament.
He was hurt while chasing down a puck in the right corner and was struck in the knee by Devils defenseman David Schlemko.
Kane is a top-line forward who has a goal and two assists in eight games.
The injury is the latest setback for Kane, who was sidelined by a season-ending shoulder injury when Buffalo acquired him in a trade with Winnipeg in February.
